Grade & Males & Females \\ \hline
$9^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $41.1\%$ & $39.4\%$ \\ \hline
$10^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $34.4\%$ & $33.1\%$ \\ \hline
$11^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $20.6\%$ & $13.8\%$ \\ \hline
$12^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $11.6\%$ & $8.6\%$ \\ \hline
\end{tabular}

1.subquestion: How many female bus riders are there in the $11^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade?

subanswer.text: To find the number of female bus riders in the $11^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade, first we find the percentage of female bus riders in the $11^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade: $13.8\%$. Then we convert the percentage to a decimal: $0.138$. Finally, we multiply the decimal by the total number of students in the $11^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade (600): $0.138 \times 600 \approx \boxed{810}$. The answer is: 810.

2.subquestion: How many male bus riders are there in the $12^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade?

subanswer.text: Using the same steps as above, the number of male bus riders in the $12^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade is approximately $\boxed{1470}$. The answer is: 1470.
